Federal College of Education (Nka na ụzụ), Akoka  (nke bụbu National Technical Teachers College) bụ Agụmakwụkwọ aka ọrụ ụlọ akwụkwọ kọleji  dị na Akoka, mpaghara Yaba, Lagos  na Lagos nke Naijiria. Founded in 1967 by the Federal Government of Nigeria, the institution was founded with the aim of "grooming and producing teachers in technical, vocational and commercial academic disciplines". The Federal College of Education (Technical), Akoka is approved by the National Universities Commission and offers the award of Nigeria Certificate in Education (NCE) and undergraduate first degree courses in technology education, having affiliated to the Federal University of Technology, Minna.
Agụmakwụkwọ ndị a na-enye ndị nkuzi;
Ụlọ ọrụ akwụkwọ a na-esonyekwa na mmemme SIWES ebe ụmụ akwụkwọ na-esonyere ndị na-arụ ọrụ na ụlọ ọrụ iji nweta ahụmịhe bara uru.
Ụlọ ọrụ akwụkwọ a jikọtara na Mahadum nke Benin, Benin City maka inye mmemme nzere bachelọ na mpaghara ndị a:
Ngalaba Mmụta aka ọrụ na nka
Ngalaba Usoro Ọmụmụ na Teknụzụ Nkuzi
Ụlọ ọrụ ahụ nwekwara njikọ na Mahadum Federal nke Nka na ụzụ, Minna.
